subject: Re: [junit] which unit test to write?

messageBody:
Ioic,

In the end, I think experience is the most reliable guide. Most
developers have experience already about tests they should have
written: they're the tests that would have prevented the bugs that
have hurt you worst. As you get more experienced, the maxim of "test
until fear turns to boredom" is wise. If you have a good
test-coverage tool, that can help generate fear, when you ask yourself
"I don't have a single unit test running this method. Am I OK with
that?"

One of my personal favorite ways to bootstrap experience is
test-driven development: every time all your tests pass, and you're
satisfied with the design of your code so far, write a test for your
next feature, which will break, and then make it pass.

Does that help?

David Saff
